title: Size 12 woman has to buy a size 20 dress in H&M thanks to weird sizes | Metro News
text:
Search Metro Follow us Size 12 woman has to buy a size 20 dress in H&M thanks to their bizarre sizes Rebecca Reid for Metro.co.uk Thursday 23 Feb 2017 3:04 pm (Picture: Marianne Gray/Deadline News) An ex-couple posed for a bleak breakup photoshoot and things got intense 
You think you know what dress size you are. But then you try something on and it’s either impossibly small or it drowns you. 
Which is exactly what happened to shopper Marianne Grey, who ordered a dress from H&M in her usual size 12. 
She tried the dress on, found that it was too small and returned it to the store, where she tried on another dress. 
And then another. And another. Eventually, after going four sizes up from her actual dress size, she managed to find a dress that fit her. 
Marianne wrote on H&M’s Facebook page to convey her confusion about the incident. 
H&M responded that this might be a ‘labeling’ issue – but if it’s a labeling issue that doesn’t really explain the number of complaints about the exact same issue on their Facebook page. 
No-one is suggesting that H&M is the only store that struggles with this issue, but I think we can all agree that it needs to be sorted out. 
On the lighter end of the scale, it’s frustrating not to know what size you need to order online. 
On the darker side of things, it’s not great for your body image to constantly think you’ve lost or gained weight, when what’s actually happened is that a shop as completely inconsistant sizing. More
